arts.ttl: PSG Willing to Spend €100M to Sign Real Madrid Standout This Summer
arts.sum: Kylian Mbappé’s move to Real Madrid has definitely shaken up the dynamic among the team’s wingers, leaving some players lower in the pecking order. From the start, there were concerns about how the French star would affect the playing time of others. arts.ttl: Aston Villa Set to Accept €77M Bid From Al-Nassr for PSG, West Ham Target
arts.sum: Paris Saint-Germain are reportedly interested in Aston Villa forward Jhon Durán as they look to secure a promising long-term addition to their attack. Journalist Ben Jacobs highlighted PSG’s interest in the Colombian striker but noted a key obstacle: Aston Villa’s £80 million valuation. This price tag reflects Durán’s strong performances and his recent contract extension. arts.ttl: Newcastle Look to Edge Chelsea, Tottenham in Race for £50M-Rated PSG Target
arts.sum: This month, a report revealed that Bournemouth’s Illia Zabarnyi emerged as an ideal candidate for Paris Saint-Germain to bolster their backline. Zabarnyi has been one of Bournemouth’s top performers this season, attracting interest from several clubs as the January transfer window approaches. arts.ttl: PSG to face Ligue 1 rivals Monaco or Brest in the Champions League play-off round
arts.sum: PSG are certain to face a Ligue 1 team – either Monaco or Brest – in a two-legged play-off round in February. The league champions have sealed their spot in…

arts.ttl: How PSG exposed Man City's weakness on the flanks
arts.sum: Nedum Onuoha and Rory Smith discuss how PSG exposed Manchester City's weakness on their flanks to pull off a 4-2 comeback win at the Parc des Princes.

arts.ttl: Dembele hat-trick sends PSG into play-offs
arts.sum: Ousmane Dembele's hat-trick helps Paris St-Germain into the Champions League play-offs in a 4-1 win over Stuttgart, eliminating the German side in the process on matchday eight of the group phase at the MHP Arena.

arts.ttl: Champions League knockout draw: Date, possible fixtures, format, bracket
arts.sum: The draw for the knockout playoff round of the new-look UEFA Champions League is upon us. Here's when it takes place and how it works.

arts.ttl: Dembélé’s hat-trick sends PSG soaring into playoffs and Stuttgart crashing out
arts.athr: Nick Ames at the MHP Arena
arts.sum: If Paris Saint-Germain were grasping for a play-off safety net just over a week ago, they ended up flinging themselves into it gleefully. Perhaps the new-look Champions League really does serve the big guns as intended: the illusion of serious jeopardy had been vivid before the sprawling final matchday kicked off but PSG, having given the neutrals their fun, swiftly made a mockery of it. Just as they had in destroying Manchester City, they looked a side whose sparkling attack could yet make a push for the latter stages. It was a performance that made nonsense of suggestions they would fail at the 36-team format’s first hurdle. Ousmane Dembélé’s exceptional hat-trick would have felt all the sweeter to the forward given he was booed throughout this game, presumably for his Borussia Dortmund connections. More pertinently, it was a reminder PSG have retained plenty of proven quality despite the departures of their superstar names. Bradley Barcola, who set the ball rolling before Stuttgart could gather breath, was unplayable and offered a blistering vision of the new generation’s capabilities. Continue reading...
German Police arrest 59 French 'hooligans' before Champions League match between Stuttgart and Paris St-Germain.

arts.ttl: Donnarumma pulls off game-defining save as PSG progresses to Champions League playoffs
arts.sum: Gianluigi Donnarumma produced a save that kept the momentum going for his team as PSG progressed to the Champions League playoffs. Barcola had scored PSG’s opening goal in the sixth minute.
